skill.name: typescript-review
skill.description: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing TypeScript/JavaScript code.
skill.summary: Review TypeScript and JavaScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only review guidelines and references to standard development commands. No executable code, no network access, no file writing, and no credential access. The allowed tools (Read, Grep, Bash, Glob) are appropriate for code review tasks.

content.value_statement: Reviewing code manually is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automates code review by checking TypeScript and JavaScript changes against project standards, catching style violations and quality issues before merge.
actual_capabilities: Reviews TypeScript and JavaScript pull requests
Checks compliance with Metabase coding standards
Identifies style violations and code quality issues
Validates JSDoc comments for clarity and completeness
Enforces type safety and proper TypeScript usage
Checks React best practices for React components
limitations: Limited to TypeScript and JavaScript code review
Does not modify or fix code automatically
Requires existing ESLint and Prettier configurations
Reviews code against predefined Metabase standards only

use_cases.title: Review JS/TS PRs
use_cases.description: Review pull requests containing TypeScript or JavaScript changes for standards compliance and quality.

use_cases.title: Speed up reviews
use_cases.description: Automatically check code changes against project standards before manual review.

use_cases.title: Enforce standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all contributed code meets coding standards and follows best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the TypeScript changes in this pull coding request for standards and style violations.

prompt_templates.title: Full Code Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a thorough code review of these JavaScript files. Check code quality, type safety, JSDoc comments, and React best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Style Check Only
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if these TypeScript changes follow the project coding style and conventions. Report any style violations.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for potential bugs, performance issues, and code quality problems. Focus on TypeScript type safety.

output_examples.input: Review the TypeScript changes in this pull request for standards compliance.
output: ‚ö† Missing JSDoc comment on function getUserData
‚ö† Consider using const instead of let on line 42

best_practices: Provide the full diff or file paths you want reviewed for accurate analysis
Run linting tools before review to catch basic style issues first
Use this skill alongside manual review for best results
Focus on logic and architecture issues that automated tools miss
anti_patterns: Asking the skill to fix code instead of just reviewing it
Expecting the skill to catch all security vulnerabilities
Using the skill without understanding the project coding standards
Relying solely on automated review without manual verification

faq.question: Does this skill work with JavaScript projects?
faq.answer: Yes, it reviews both TypeScript and JavaScript files. It checks standard JavaScript patterns and ES6+ syntax.

faq.question: Can this skill fix the issues it finds?
faq.answer: No, this skill only identifies issues. You can ask Claude to fix them after review.

faq.question: Does it work with any ESLint config?
faq.answer: The skill reviews code against general standards. Project-specific rules require ESLint configuration.

faq.question: Is my code safe during review?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only reads code using safe tools. No code is modified or sent anywhere.

faq.question: Why did it miss an issue?
faq.answer: The skill may miss context-dependent issues. Always verify important findings manually.

faq.question: How is this different from ESLint?
faq.answer: ESLint catches syntax and style issues. This skill provides deeper code quality review and best practice guidance.
